meanings.definition: The state or quality of being pale.
meanings.sent1: Her palenesses were noticeable after spending the entire winter indoors.
meanings.sent2: The palenesses of the walls made the room feel cold and unwelcoming.
meanings.sent3: The palenesses of the ghost made it look like a sheet floating in the air.
meanings.sent4: The palenesses of the moon cast an eerie glow over the dark forest.
meanings.sent5: The palenesses of the snow-covered landscape were blinding in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The artist mixed white and blue to create the perfect palenesses for the sky.
meanings.sent2: The palenesses of the flower petals gave them a delicate and ethereal look.
meanings.sent3: The palenesses of the paint made the room feel bright and airy.
meanings.sent4: The palenesses of the morning sky signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The palenesses of her skin indicated she needed more time in the sun.
